alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Erie and northwestern Crawford Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Albion, or near Conneaut, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albion, Cranesville, Springboro and Platea. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern Ohio...and northwestern Pennsylvania.
